program codeforces_32_B

  implicit none

  character(len=1000) :: input_string
  integer :: i, len_input
  logical :: flag = .false. read(*, '(A)' ) input_string
  len_input = len_trim( input_string )

  do i = 1, len_input

      if (input_string(i:i) == '.' ) then

          if (flag ) then
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 1
              flag = .false.
          else
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 0
          end if

      else

          if (flag ) then
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 2
              flag = .false. else
              flag = .true.
          end if

      end if

  end do

end program codeforces_32_B

tree.original_reasoning:
Okay, I need to translate this Java code to Fortran. Let me start by understanding what the Java code does. The program takes a string input, processes each character, and outputs numbers based on certain conditions.

First, the Java code uses a Scanner to read input. In Fortran, I can read from the standard input using a read statement. But since the input might be a string ( likely a string like "a.b.c..." etc.), I should declare a character variable to hold it. The length might be an issue here. Maybe I can read it into a string with a sufficiently large length to hold any input line.

program codeforces_32_B

implicit none

character(len=1000) :: s
logical :: s_flag = .false.
integer :: i, len_s

read(*,'(A)') s ! read the whole line into s
len_s = len_trim(s)

do i = 1, len_s
   if (s(i:i) == '.') then
      ! process the '.' case
      if (s_flag) then
          write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 1
          s_flag = .false.
      else
          write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 0
      end if
   else
      ! process other characters
      if (s_flag) then
          write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 2
          s_flag = .false.
      else
          s_flag = .true.
      end if
   end if
end do

write(*,*) ! to flush with a new line? Not sure if needed.

end program

The program could look like:

program codeforces_32_B

  implicit none

  character(len=1000) :: input_string
  integer :: i, len_input
  logical :: flag = .false.

  read(*, '(A)' ) input_string
  len_input = len_trim( input_string )

  do i = 1, len_input

      if (input_string(i:i) == '.' ) then

          if (flag ) then
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 1
              flag = .false.
          else
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 0
          end if

      else

          if (flag ) then
              write(*,'(I1)', advance='no') 2
              flag = .false.
          else
              flag = .true.
          end if

      end if

  end do

end program codeforces_32_B
